intro: Imperatia bithynica, commonly known as the Bithynian imperatia, is a flowering plant native to parts of Europe and Asia. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in grasslands and open woodlands, preferring well-drained soils. Its leaves are alternate, lance-shaped, and often have a hairy texture. The flowers are yellow and appear in clusters, attracting various pollinators such as bees and butterflies.
